alert.note: Alert for Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 6:50AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Very Stormy from Wednesday Night Through Thursday... From Wednesday into the weekend, a series of very strong Bering Sea storms will bring gales and heavy rain to Western Alaska. A weak low now over Kamchatka will deepen rapidly and move to the Central Bering Sea on Wed, and to the Northern Bering Sea on Thu. This will spread rain to the West Coast Wed night and Thu. This will bring southeast winds of 25 to 35 mph to the West Coast Wed night, and south winds 25 to 35 mph on Thu. This could cause high surf with minor coastal flooding along the West Coast south of the Bering Strait from Thu into early Fri. A second and stronger storm, with the remnants of Tropical Storm Merbok, will move north into the Central Bering Sea on Fri and to along the West Coast on Sat. Weather models vary significantly on the track of this feature, and so it is too early to say much about it except that it will bring very strong winds and heavy rain to most of the West Coast over the weekend. This will also bring a possibility of coastal flooding south of the Bering Strait Fri PM into Sun AM, but there is still much uncertainty about coastal flooding.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta
